qa_pair.question: Please explain how to 'format' memory card in camera?  Thought a memory card was just inserted in camera & it was ready to point & click.  Thanks
qa_pair.answer:
Generally, if a memory card is new it does not need to be formatted.  Formatting is just erasing everything on the memory card and starting over.  To format it on the camera, go to the button just under the trash button and press it.  It shows capture and setup - highlight Setup.  Scroll down to format and press enter.If you want to format the memory card, scroll up to "memory card" and enter.  Scroll up to OK and press enter.  The camera will format the card and you are ready to take new pictures on it.  I think it is easier to just insert the memory card into a computer, find it under "my computer", right click on it and you are offered the option to format it.

qa_pair.question: Are there any plastic parts in it?Is it lead-free?
qa_pair.answer: It is as lead free as something has to be to be sold in California,  which is pretty lead free.  Did you know that most brass has some lead content?In California, lead-free materials must be used for "each component that comes into contact with the wetted surface of pipes and pipe fittings, plumbing fittings and fixtures." On January 1, 2010, the maximum amount of lead in "lead-free brass" in California was reduced from 4% to 0.25% lead.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this Battery Minder to keep an electric golf carts batteries (6 of them) charged for 5 months?
qa_pair.answer: I believe the limit would be 4 (2x 6v in a series/parallel configuration).  To be sure, contact the BatteryMinder folks.  I'm using it on 4 7 year old golf carts myself although I have 6 total from a previous solar setup.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this Battery Minder to keep an electric golf carts batteries (6 of them) charged for 5 months?
qa_pair.answer:
I would add to my previous comment that you would want to bring them to full charge with charger and use the BatteryMinder only as a maintainer/desulfator.  They should all be in similar condition.  If you find one 12v pairing has a lesser condition, I would suggest desulfating the pairs separately, spending more time on the weaker pair.  From what I understand, desulfating a bank in series/parallel will tend to favor the batteries that are in better condition.  You can make a Kentucky windage determination of condition by measuring resting voltage or be more precise by measuring specific gravity of each cell.

qa_pair.question: TO CANON T5I ??
qa_pair.answer: These lenses take what is called a T mount adapter. They have a different, bayonet mount for each camera brand, but all screw onto the same thread on the lens. This is why they are so inexpensive. There is no electronic focus, or f-stop setting system.

qa_pair.question: TO CANON T5I ??
qa_pair.answer:
These lenses take what is called a T mount adapter. They have a different, bayonet mount for each camera brand, but all screw onto the same thread on the lens. This is why they are so inexpensive. There is no electronic focus, or f-stop setting system. Focus, and stopping down the pre-set lens and almost EVERYTHING is manual. You will have to set the Auto ISO to manual. You may get lucky and have the camera be able to select the proper shutter speed, by setting the camera on Av. The trick is, to estimate the ISO high enough to allow the camera to select a short enough shutter speed when you manually stop the lens down. Having said that, and without checking anyone's manual, I would say if you order this lens with the Canon T-mount adapter, it should fit your Canon. Most important, if you want the really sharp photos this lens is capable of delivering, you will need a good tripod. Do not, repeat do not buy the catadioptric (mirror) lens similar to this one, unless you are REALLY strapped for weight. This lens is NOT a "peace of sheet" as one poster put it, but it does have the limitations I described.

qa_pair.question: Is this good for a Canon 40D?
qa_pair.answer: OK, the answer is, any camera for which you can buy a T adapter, will work with this lens. See this article at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Canon_EOS for more information.  The lens is a T-mount with an EF adapter, so it will fit any Canon with an EF mount. If you can get a Canon T adapter, then it will work with any Canon camera. You can use a 2x adapter between the lens and body. There is a kit with it included on Amazon. Each camera brand has a different bayonet mount but all screw onto the same thread on the lens which is why they are so inexpensive. There is no electronic focus, or f-stop setting system. Note that you might find it difficult to stabilize the lens enough to get decent photographs. Keep in mind that since there is no autofocus coupling, no exposure coupling, and the lens is a preset lens, you have to know how to use your camera on manual for your particular camera. You'll need a good tripod and a very well lit place for high quality photos, however fast moments will likely still be fuzzy. qa_pair.question: Does the Nuvi 2597lmt POI show rest stops along the  highways? If not on POI, Where can it be found?How effective if the Active Voice Assist?
qa_pair.answer: There is an 'up ahead' feature that displays on the right side of the screen. You can choose what to display (up to 3) and it shows (typically) next gas, next rest stop, next food (on your route). If you don't have a destination it won't display anything in this area. qa_pair.question: can it be used for a washing machine drain dry well
qa_pair.answer: Drain water from a washing machine is considered "greywater" and this well can certainly be used for it. "Blackwater," (which is sewage) is not allowed. qa_pair.question: Can this be used for water softener backwash? in Massachusetts?
qa_pair.answer: Most water softeners use a three step process to recharge the cartridge, The first is backwash, the second is the brine soak, the third is rinse. In most water softeners all three steps discharge liquid through the same tube. The second step is the problem.  If you use sodium chloride to recharge the resin cartridge the concentrated salt water will be discharged into the ground. You could switch to potassium chloride which is more expensive but less harmful to ground water.

qa_pair.question: Dr Weil recommends Active UMF 20+ Manuka Honey.  Does anyone know if this is the same or similar? Tx
qa_pair.answer: This is similar to UMF10+ honey.MGO 400 (methylglyoxal) is equivalent to NPA 12.9 (non-peroxide activity) which would be rated UMF10+ if this was a licensed UMF honey.There's an online conversion calculator for UMF/NPA to MGO ratings at: http://www.umf.org.nz/umf-trademark/methylglyoxal-npa-honey-conversion-calculatorTo get an MGO honey equivalent to UMF20+ you'd need an MGO rating over 800.

qa_pair.question: Dr Weil recommends Active UMF 20+ Manuka Honey.  Does anyone know if this is the same or similar? Tx
qa_pair.answer: UMF is an independent industry standard. MGO is specific to one company.  This website says that MGO 400 is equivalent to UMF 20+ http://www.manukahoneybenefit.com/umf/

qa_pair.question: Dr Weil recommends Active UMF 20+ Manuka Honey.  Does anyone know if this is the same or similar? Tx
qa_pair.answer: This is similar to something close to 13+ or 14+ Manuka Honey. Per the UMF grading system found here (http://www.umf.org.nz/grading-system), UMF 20+ would have greater than or equal to 829 mg/kg.  10+UMF has greater than 263 mg/kg and 15+ has 514 mg/kg, so this product by Manuka Health is equivalent to somewhere between UMF 10+ and UMF 15+

Is coffee it makes strong enough? 
stronger brew coffee .

qa_pair.question: Is coffee it makes strong enough? Are there any deference when you using "bold" model? Just wondering a scoop or a keurig with reusable filter.
qa_pair.answer: Depends on what you mean by "strong enough." I've used only the Bold setting, so I can't speak to any difference between that and regular. According to the directions, you can vary the strength of the brew by varying the coarseness of the grind (finer grind takes longer to drip so it yields a stronger brew), but I always use the same grind, so I can't speak to specific results.

qa_pair.question: Is coffee it makes strong enough? Are there any deference when you using "bold" model? Just wondering a scoop or a keurig with reusable filter.
qa_pair.answer: No, it's not, it's terrible. Gave ours away.  We use a Keurig with an Easy Cup system. Unlike this machine, the E-Z Cup and the E-Z Cup filters were well thought out and make an excellent cup of coffee. You can use your favorite coffee, and it's perfect every time. Also, you don't have to pay bloated prices for Keurig K-cups.

qa_pair.question: Is coffee it makes strong enough? Are there any deference when you using "bold" model? Just wondering a scoop or a keurig with reusable filter.
qa_pair.answer: You don't need a filter as long as the grind is the right size. I grind my coffee to the largest "fine ground" setting and its perfect, You can put as much coffee as you like and add your cinnamon or whatever else spice you prefer. I had a kerig for about  a week. I hated it as I could not adjust the strength of the coffee. Even with the disposal gold cup it didn't hold enough coffee, nor was it hot enough and I had to always have a gallon of water in it, even if I only wanted one cup. Besides from a percolator this is the best little coffee maker I have ever had.

qa_pair.question: Is coffee it makes strong enough? Are there any deference when you using "bold" model? Just wondering a scoop or a keurig with reusable filter.
qa_pair.answer: If you don't care what your coffee tastes like, then this is the machine for you. We gave ours away. Water temp is just North of lukewarm. Uses a lot of coffee grounds to make a cup of weak, lukewarm, cardboard-like tasting coffee.

qa_pair.question: Is coffee it makes strong enough? Are there any deference when you using "bold" model? Just wondering a scoop or a keurig with reusable filter.
qa_pair.answer: I just got one yesterday and haven't been able to get a good, strong cup yet.  I've filled the filter to the top and tried the bold setting but the coffee is still a bit bland.  It is very hot, though, contrary to what a previous member posted.  I will be experimenting with a few different blends to see if I can kick up the flavor a bit more.  It's a great machine in theory, just need to find the right blend.

qa_pair.question: Is coffee it makes strong enough? Are there any deference when you using "bold" model? Just wondering a scoop or a keurig with reusable filter.
qa_pair.answer: Bold setting drips the water SLOWER. What is actually does is turn the heating element ON AND OFF.If you want the strongest coffee (from any coffee maker) just grind the beans LONGER! If you don't grind your own beans then use a filter model, but then again if you don't grind your own beans for each pot it's a waste of time even talking to you! (:-}

qa_pair.question: How do you eliminate the opening where the sun shines through between the car visor and this product??
qa_pair.answer: Sally, there's a very simple answer. When the Polarized visor is mounted as instructed, it's on the bottom of the car visor. Pull it down from the car visor just about half-way, and then push the car visor all way forward towards the windshield (if the polarized visor was still folded up, it would actually be on top of the car visor). Then just adjust the polarized visor to your correct height by tilting it towards you or lowering the car visor a bit. There won't be any gap.

rewrite.edit: Mount the Polarized visor as instructed. To remove any gaps, pull the car visor down half-way and push it all the way forward towards the windshield. Adjust the polarized visor to your correct height by tilting it towards you or lowering the car visor.

The product is mounted on the bottom of the car visor. To block sun shine, pull it down about half-way from the car visor and push the car visor all the way forward towards the windshield. Take note if the visor is folded, it would be on top of the car visor. Then adjust the polarized visor to the correct height by tilting it or lowering the car visor.

When the polarized visor is in use as instructed, pull it down and push it towards the windshield and then adjust it to your correct height to cover the gap you wish to cover so there isn't any sun peeking through undesirably

qa_pair.question: How do you eliminate the opening where the sun shines through between the car visor and this product??
qa_pair.answer: Sally,  The way I do this is by changing the angular relationship between the car visor and the polarizing filter. I drop the car visor just enough to deploy the filter and then angle the filter to get it before my eyes but not so much as to create the gap you are talking about.  I believe if you experiment with this idea you will find it works.  But be aware this filter is not for direct sunlight relief.  Polarizing filters are for reflected light.  If you are going to drive during hours of low direct sunlight you will need a dark shade filter in addition to this products.  Mark

qa_pair.question: How do you eliminate the opening where the sun shines through between the car visor and this product??
qa_pair.answer: Hi Sally,  If the car visor is at a 90 degree angle from the roof of the car, the gap shows and sunlight comes through.  But by tilting the car visor 80-85 degree angle and with the attached visor pulled down, the gap is not seen.  Thus your eyes are not blinded by the sun.  I especially love it on those times driving into the sunset.

qa_pair.question: How do you eliminate the opening where the sun shines through between the car visor and this product??
qa_pair.answer: Sally, I can't remember exactly, so you might have to experiment with my explanation.  I removed the "visor piece" from the unit, and turned it around. I re-installed the unit, and the space you mentioned is gone.  Good Luck!  It did work for me.  Joeittle

qa_pair.question: Are they free of leaven?
qa_pair.answer: Leavened matzo is an oxymoron.  No matzo is leavened.  The whole point is to celebrate the Israelites escaping from Egypt and not having the time to allow the bread to rise while on the run.

qa_pair.question: Is this printer compatible with an Apple Time Capsule router?
qa_pair.answer: Compatibility is a funny thing. I would suggest leaving them alone in a room together a few minutes at first. Then gradually increase the time each day. Watch for increased compatibility as they get to know each other. A true friendship could develop, but possibly only a working relationship  based on familiarity and mutual respect is the best you will get. So, yeah, they are compatible, but don't rush it.

qa_pair.question: is black & white only printing also doable
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely. You just choose color on the printer options before sending it off to be printed. All color printers can print in black and white. qa_pair.question: He, would a 2000w generator be able to run this charger?
qa_pair.answer: Probably yes, as long as there were no other major loads on the generator. This unit draws a maximum of 13 amps at 120 VAC which equates to about 1560 watts, make it just over 1600 watts if you account for the charger efficiency of >93%. Obviously these numbers are based on maximum output form the charger (100 amps). You may want to consider a power conditioner in between the generator and the charger, depending on how clean the power is from your generator. If it is an inverter generator then this is not necessary. Hope this helps.

qa_pair.question: does it have caller id
qa_pair.answer: No. It is a standard desk phone virtually unchanged in design since the 1970's. This is about as basic as a phone can be, with an amplified receiver as about it's only feature. qa_pair.question: does it have caller id
qa_pair.answer: No CallerID on this phone.  This phone design was made before CallerID.  To use CallerID with such a phone you would need a separate stand-alone CallerID device.

summary: This phone is made in the USA and comes in red and black colors. The ringer on this phone is an old-fashioned bell. The product can be connected to an answering machine as long as the machine can connect to the phone line. This phone comes with a normal length cord and is made of lightweight plastic. This can work with a digital phone service from a cable company but it plugs into a normal phone line. The phone does not have caller ID because it does not have a screen.

summary: The product requires a Blu-Ray writer to be burned. The product works fine on lite-on and lg burners and on external Sea Tech Aluminum Drive for Macs. The disks are unable to work with the Asus BW12B1ST burner. A firmware update will fix most read/write issues with the burner product. Customers should avoid burning their disks faster than the rated speed to avoid Coasters issues. There is silver writing on the top of the product but it is not shiny. The disks are HTL and are not inkjet printable.

qa_pair.question: will these work with the olympus stylus TG-2 camera?

qa_pair.question: will these work with the olympus stylus TG-2 camera?
qa_pair.answer: If the diameter of your lens is threaded and the diameter is 40.5 mm, it should work.  The thread on the lens is standardized and located on the inside of the retaining ring holding the lens to the barrel.  If your lens is larger or smaller than 40.5 mm, you can buy an adapter.  Incidentally, the diameter is often printed on the ring around the perimeter of the lens.

qa_pair.question: Is this considered a holographic sight? Is there a difference in reflex and holographic?
qa_pair.answer: It is not a true holographic sight like an eotech. ..where the image is created between 2 thin panes of glass. The sight mark is a red dot still where a beam is projected on the glass. It is a good red dot for the price though.

qa_pair.question: Is this considered a holographic sight? Is there a difference in reflex and holographic?
qa_pair.answer:
A holographic sight uses a pulse generator to beam the laser onto the glass. Millions of times a second. Your point of aim will shift with your eye movement and help facilitate both eyes open shooting. Can run into $7-800.00 for a truly good one. The sightmark is a red dot or "reflex" sight in that the laser is focused in one spot on the pane of glass. As with all things everyone has their preferences. For the price, the sightmark is a heck of  a deal. Good lock for the scope rail decent illumination through the lens and light weight and compact. They will also take a beating. Mine is mounted on a .357 magnum. It's gone through hundreds of rounds with no sign of a defect. Bottom line is price and the application the sight will be used for. Just target shooting you certainly don't need a trijicon or eotech. Jumping out of airplanes or storming castles... different scenario. Hope I've been of assistance.

qa_pair.question: Is this considered a holographic sight? Is there a difference in reflex and holographic?
qa_pair.answer: Unlike a laser or red dot sights (reflex), the holographic image projects no forward light onto the target and thus no position revealing light. The projected reticle is only visible by the operator. The operator remains completely hidden downrange even against night vision systems.

qa_pair.question: Do then filter out germs
qa_pair.answer: (Note: Micron=Micrometer, a form of measurement) The answer is in the fact that it filters to 0.1 microns, Simple put, since different germs are different sizes it will filter out a large amount of germs yet not even close to all.  A more indepth answer is bacteria are usually 2-0.2 microns large(This will filter bacteria) while viruses can be 0.2-0.002 microns(Some viruses are filtered). Fungus spores are 20-4 microns so you shouldn't need to worry about this filtering fungus spores.

rewrite.edit: The product does filter out germs to 0.1 microns.  This is a lot of germs, but not even close to all germs.  Germs are different sizes and this product will only filter out germs to 0.1 microns.  It will filter some viruses but not fungus spores.

summary: This pad will scratch gel-coated marble because it is abrasive. The Casabella Flex Neck is good for cleaning bathtubs and old-fashioned porcelain wall tile. Search for these in the Sponge Mop section. This pad works on the curves between the walls and the curved bottom of the tub but must be pressed hard to get it to bend when new. It will be much more flexible with regular use. Extra sponges are unavailable with this package but can be purchased on Amazon. The sponge attaches to the holder easily with Velcro-like backing. The holder attaches to the pole via a flexible rubber neck and it is durable. This scrubber is safe for the acrylic enclosed bath fitter, with no bending required. This product can also be used in a fully hones marble shower or on polished marble, as it is able to clean tile and grout well with no scratches. It is not recommended for use on fiberglass, as fiberglass should be cleaned with a non abrasive microfiber cloth.

qa_pair.question: Can i put it together/  75 year old woman,
qa_pair.answer: that's not an easy question to answer.  Are you strong enough to move it around ?  Are you able to use a screwdriver and a couple of wrenches ?  If the answer is YES to these concerns then you should probably be able to assemble the bridge.

rewrite.edit: The bridge is assembled by moving some parts around and using a screwdriver and some wrenches.

qa_pair.question: Can i put it together/  75 year old woman,
qa_pair.answer: I used a monkey wrench in each hand to tighten the nuts and bolts (easy work) and a clamp to position the stretchers (difficult) and a power screwdriver to drive the many screws (easy work).  I worked slowly taking 2 days and I carried the fine looking bridge outside to where I needed it. I'm 88.

qa_pair.question: Can i put it together/  75 year old woman,
qa_pair.answer: The box it came in was heavy. I just stained it my husband put it together. If you have an electric screw driver he said it would be easy. But it would be hard if you were using just a regular screw driver.

qa_pair.question: Can i put it together/  75 year old woman,
qa_pair.answer: Probably, but it does require some time and involves numerous nuts and bolts that need to be tightened.  There are no heavy items.  Might be good to have a helper, but it is not complicated, so someone young can help to (I set mine up with my 7 year old son and he enjoyed putting it together).

qa_pair.question: Can i put it together/  75 year old woman,
qa_pair.answer: It is not technically difficult, but an extra hand to hold boards in place while tightening might be more helpful.  My husband had to muscle a few boards to get them to fit in place.  Tools needed: electric screwdriver and a wrench or socket set. This bridge does come with a finish to the cedar boards.

qa_pair.question: Can i put it together/  75 year old woman,
qa_pair.answer: It took my engineer husband 20 minutes, and unless you are very agile and follow instructions, it might be tricky.  It is definately worth the trouble and needs no extra tools to assemble.  It isn't heavy, just a little bulky.

qa_pair.question: Can i put it together/  75 year old woman,

qa_pair.question: Can i put it together/  75 year old woman,

summary: To change the batteries in this product, any device present on the right hand side must be removed to provide access to the right hand battery compartment. The left hand battery compartment remains accessible even with a keyboard and trackpad installed. This Bluefin is used to hold an Apple keyboard and a trackpad together. It is possible to use this product on a soft surface such as a bed if the product is properly supported. This item features two power buttons that are located on the right side of the product, as well as silicone tabs that cover the screw top in order to allow the adjoining power button for the keyboard and track pad to be engaged when the left side of the keyboard and the right side of the track pad are pressed against each other. This product features a thin silicone sticker that cover the battery door of one of the attached devices so that the power for the other device can be turned on by lightly squeezing both devices together while they are attached with the Bluefin. It may be necessary to use another item to keep the keyboard and trackpad separate during transport to prevent power from being turned on accidentally. This product is not compatible with the Logitech K811 keyboard. Information about this product's compatibility with iPads is unavailable. To determine whether this product would fit a keyboard that measures 11 x 5 1/16 inches and a trackpad that measures 5 1/4 x 5 1/16 inches, it would be necessary to compare those dimensions with the dimensions of the apple wireless keyboard and track pad for which this product was made. This product is designed to fit Apple brand wireless keyboards and trackpads and is not compatible with other brands such as Logitech.

qa_pair.answer: The screen is small enough to retain particles up to very small size, so it will eliminate those. I have found it more than satisfactory for my needs. However, it won't have the effect of fine cheesecloth, but it's a lot easier and quicker to clean!

qa_pair.question: Will this strain broth with a clear broth result?
qa_pair.answer: No it is not fine enough.  To make an absolutely transparent broth you can not just use a strainer even of the finest mesh. You can come close with a combination of this item plus the use of a jelly strainer. To be completely transparent you must follow directions for consommé in a good cook book, it is not and easy task without serious skill. This item will however work if you just need broth for a clear liquids diet.

qa_pair.question: Could this be hung with a hook at the top?
qa_pair.answer: If you were to hang it, it would require being hung with three connecting points in a triangular pattern using fishing line or wire so that the baskets would remain level. Otherwise, using only one point of connection, (hook or wire) in the loop of the frame, the baskets will tilt to the open side away from the frame and would likely not be well balanced to hold anything in the baskets without spilling.

qa_pair.question: Can i copy dvd to dvd?
qa_pair.answer: Depending on your software, you can create an "ISO" file on your PC, from the original DVD in your LG BD drive. Then, after replacing the original DVD with a blank DVD of the same capacity, you can make a copy of the original DVD, onto the blank DVD, from the ISO file.  The program ImgBurn, does this very well; not only for DVDs, but for Blu-Ray discs and CDs.  Copy-protected disc may not be able to be copied. Hope this helps.

rewrite.edit: This product could possibly copy dvd to dvd if running right software. IMG burn runs well for blu ray and cds. ISO file for PC. Some copyright laws could prevent some burning.

qa_pair.question: How does a random orbital sander compare to a disk sander in application?  If you are finishing steel which is preferrable?
qa_pair.answer: The random orbital sander is more or less a finishing sander mainly for wood or plastic.  A disc sander used to reduce welds or heavy metal is a rather rough sander.  If you were to use a random orbital sander to do more than remove paint from steel, you would be sanding for a long time.

rewrite.edit: The product being an orbital sander is a finishing sander mainly for wood or plastic, compared to a disc sander which is used to reduce welds or heavy metal. The product would take a long time if used for removing paint from steel.
If you were to use a random orbital sander to do more than remove paint from steel, you would be sanding for a long time.

This product is suitable for finishing of wood or plastic and would not be ideal for more than minor jobs involving metal, as opposed to a disc sander that is rougher and more suitable for heavy metal.

qa_pair.question: How does a random orbital sander compare to a disk sander in application?  If you are finishing steel which is preferrable?
qa_pair.answer: The rigid oscillating edge belt/ spindle sander is worth checking too I have one and it really is worth every cent on wood I've never used it on metal. Which ever one you choose it's important to get the right sand paper

qa_pair.question: How does a random orbital sander compare to a disk sander in application?  If you are finishing steel which is preferrable?
qa_pair.answer: A disk sander spins In a continuous.circle and your supposed to only use one half of the disk for your sanding   a random orbit the pad orbits in tiny circles I forget what this one is 1/32 or something really it depends on the project but I like the random orbit because you can use the whole pad if it's a big project. For smaller projects I would use the disk sander so you can hold the piece with two hands

qa_pair.question: How does a random orbital sander compare to a disk sander in application?  If you are finishing steel which is preferrable?
qa_pair.answer: A lot depends on the project.  If the project is primarily wood, then the random sanders by your major manufacturers is the way to go.  If the project is manly metal (steel, etc.) then the way to go is the disc sander.  Disc sanders are more aggressive than the small electric sanders.  They are for smoothing and evening out glued up pieces.  Another way to look at it is to say if you want to remove a lot of material fast, use the disc sander.  For everything else, use the random orbit.

qa_pair.answer: Yes, the sanding pad/paper attaches to the sanding disk like "Velcro". It is a hook and eye setup, and works well. I have had Makita and Porter Cable palm sanders (1/4 sheets)for years, but I like this better because of the variable speed control. Good luck with you choice

qa_pair.question: Is there a pad under the sanding disk that allows for a bit of flex? Meaning will it accommodate a slight amount of curve in the surface being sanded?
qa_pair.answer: I have used the Porter Cable 330 quarter sheet sander for 30 years and it has a very soft pad. This Makita Pad is not as soft as that....and I would call it almost rigid. I have both sanders and they are both excellent. The Porter Cable has the softer pad though.

qa_pair.question: Is there a pad under the sanding disk that allows for a bit of flex? Meaning will it accommodate a slight amount of curve in the surface being sanded?
qa_pair.answer: Yes there is an almost 1/2 " rubberized pad that does flex. But I have seen videos that recommend runningas flat as possible. Nice machine.

summary: This product is an orbital finishing sander used mainly for wood or plastic, compared to a disc sander which is used to reduce welds or heavy metal. The product is easy to connect to a shop vac through the port where the bag was connected. The voltage for this product is 110 volt AC. The port is about an inch and adaptor kits can be found for different sizes. The support grip has the ability to rotate and the knob unscrews enough to remove the band. It has an extra knob near the front and rear handle to make it super easy to use during long sanding periods. It comes with a cloth bag that fits on a 1/8th turn to release a hard rubber fitting and never falls off. It has a button in the handle to lock trigger on and a pad under the sanding disk that helps with maneuverability and command of the sander. Note that the product would take a long time to remove paint from steel.

qa_pair.question: The photo on the Q&A section is rectangular, but the photo at the top of listing is the molded Classic model.  Whichmodel will seller ship?
qa_pair.answer: It is the classic molded model.  However it varies slightly from the picture (No black wording, and one less latch).  Also, although it looks like it is all one piece, the portion that goes over the bar separates from the case.  It is not like the "one-piece" cases from back in the 1970's were the entire case was one solid piece with a top of the case and the bottom.  You place the sleeve ove rthe bar, then the saw in the case.  The case holds the bar sleeve, but is not a part of the case.

I swapped out the OEM fan and heatsink supplied with the AMD quad core CPU on my motherboard with a taller heatsink and larger fan and had lots of room to spare in between the top of the fan and the inside of the side panel facing it ... there's also ample room for your cooling fluid piping ... hope this helps

summary: This micro case will fit a micro-sized unit, or it will fit a full-size unit as long as both are the tax power supply.If both the motherboard and case are M-ATX they should work well together. qa_pair.question: do you have to take the cable out of the box every time you open it?
qa_pair.answer: It has 2 pieces. One is the cable which I keep permanently attached to my radiator. It plugs into the side of the box kind of like a cell phone plugs into the cigarette lighter in your car. It slide in and out of the plug easily and quickly when unlocked. The other piece has the same plug but no cable so it can lock the box without having to secure it to an object. This piece must also be removed in the same manner in order to open the box. qa_pair.question: do you have to take the cable out of the box every time you open it?

Note that the box is not fireproof.

It also won't fit under the majority of car seats  it is moderately difficult to cut the cable. Scissors and wire cutters might be capable but it would be difficult but Bolt cutters would make it easy on the other hand. The time it would take to steal this box from a vehicle would vary according to their preparedness. The PP1k is a larger, thicker, more secure version of this product. qa_pair.question: why are there 2 tubes. Not sure what the skinny brush is for. It feels very dry. Help
qa_pair.answer: The skinny tube is the gel that adheres and secures the fiber on the lashes.First apply a thin layer of your own mascara and allow it to dry. qa_pair.question: Can the lamp swivel to a point where the bulbs are pointing up, towards the ceiling?
qa_pair.answer: No.  The metal lid/cover over the bulb does not swivel allowing a change in the direction of the light.  A drawback, in my opinion.  The arm does swivel so the light can be shifted from straight down on your work surface to up on a wall, but I haven't found that swivel to be helpful. qa_pair.question: Restore disk included: what is this restore disk? Is it possible with it to do the fresh install of Windows 7 Home Premium on a new hard disk?
qa_pair.answer: The restore disk, if a separate DVD with the software on it, yes.  On the other hand, these sometimes come with an installation in place already on the HDD, and you would have to make a clone of the drive to do the install on a new HDD.  The last option is to do your setup on the drive that comes with the PC, and THEN clone the drive to a new (larger) drive.  This is all legal and above board as long as you don't use the OS in another PC.There are several products available for cloning a HDD.  Some of them are even free for this purpose...

rewrite.edit: The restore disk is a separate DVD with the software on it. However these sometimes come with an installation in place already on the HDD and you would have to make a clone of the drive to do the install on a new HDD. The last option is to do your setup on the drive that comes with the PC and then clone the drive to a new, larger drive. This is all legal and above board as long as you don't use the OS in another PC. There are several products available for cloning a HDD, where some of them are even free.

The restore disk is included and can be installed fresh on a Windows 7 Home Premium on a new hard disk. Sometimes these are already installed though.  You can clone the item to install on a new HDD. You can also clone the drive into a new larger drive as well.

A restore disk is used to make a clone of drive and can be used if a seperate software cd is included. Another option is to setupon current computer then replicate on larger drive. This setup is allowable as long as operating system isn't used with another computer.

qa_pair.question: Are they throw always after one use?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, they are single use items.I use these when playing golf on cold mornings. I open one ~1 hr before playing and discard them when finished playing; therefore I get ~5-6 hrs. use out of each one. They are still warm/hot when I dispose of them. I live in Arizona where I only need them on cold mornings. I'm not sure how long they would last if I was doing outdoor activities all day in a cold climate.I used to but these at a golf store that charge ~$2 per 2 pack so buying in bulk is a good savings!

qa_pair.question: Are they throw always after one use?
qa_pair.answer: Once the airtight packaging is opened the handwarmers start a reaction with oxygen in the air and the handwarmer ingredients, that creates heat, and lasts about 10 hours. After this time the reaction stops and can not be recharged. If oxygen is cut off, such as putting them into a ziplock bag, the reaction stops and they cool. Exposed to air again they resume generating heat, but never beyond a total of 10 hours they would have lasted if they were used continuously.

qa_pair.question: Can this unit be positioned basically flush against a wall?  Seems like the air intake is only in the front and the exhaust at the top?
qa_pair.answer: Yes and no.  First of all, the cord comes out of the back so the unit can't be flushed against the wall. You will need to give about 2-3" of clearance or the cord will be stressed from bending.  Second, the unit does get warm.  Since the wall is an insulator, it prevents heat from maximum dissipation, making it less efficient.   Third, some wall coatings, i.e. paint and wallpaper glue, shrinks or gets brittle from prolonged heating.  So while it's possible to place this very close to the wall, it's not advisable.

rewrite.edit: This product's cord is released from the back and requires two to three inches of clearance (to prevent the cord from bending). Additionally, the product gets warm which can cause damage to some wall coatings. While possible to place this unit close to the wall, it's not recommended.

summary: This product collects water that is essentially distilled, making it suitable for houseplants. Be aware, however, that airborne contaminates that will potentially be collected. The product is 10 inches deep, with a partially recessed, flexible hose that is about one to two inches long. This product uses a fitted, short clear hose for continuous draining. An adapter can slip into the hose, allowing a garden hose to be threaded through the product. The product's vent is on top of the unit, allowing the warm air to release straight up without adjustment. This product is 240 watts, although the start up vs running requirements for electricity can be searched to confirm this. The product's capacity is about 5 quarts which is half of what the unit pulls in from air in one day. This product's cord is released from the back and requires two to three inches of clearance (to prevent the cord from bending). Additionally, the product gets warm which can cause damage to some wall coatings. While it is possible to place this unit close to the wall, it's not recommended. This product has multiple settings for humidity, some low enough that the fan could potentially never reach shutoff.

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: The LED light and sensor panel are well sealed from outdoor moisture.  The battery cover is removable and can't be sealed, but does have a close fit.  It may be wise to check the battery terminals for cleanliness when you change batteries.  The terminals can be cleaned with WD-40 and Isopropyl alcohol.  The WD-40 removes tarnish and corrosion then the alcohol removes the WD-40.

rewrite.edit:
How is this light

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: I had it over my garage door and the 1st night it rained, water got into the battery compartment and motion sensor. I put it in a bowl of rice for a few days and it got most out to the point to where it would work again. I put a sealant around anywhere that i thought water could get in and it's been great ever since.  It just doesnt look the greatest lol. So to answer your question, it isnt weather proof unless you make it that way. Hope i helped.

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: I had this light out in the Pennsylvania rain and snow all year and it works like a dream.

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: I put it under the eave of my mom's house and in about 2 months she said it didn't work too well. I took it down and it was all corroded up inside where the batteries go. Not sure what caused this but I put new batteries in it and it didn't come on, so I cleaned on it a little more and it still wouldn't work...so I tossed it. I don't think I'll buy another one. BTW she lives in Southwest VA. near TN./VA. line, so I don't think wet weather is an issue in this instance. They may have improved them now as this was over a year ago.RKG

qa_pair.question: How weatherproof is this light?
qa_pair.answer: Well, I have three.   One is inside a 7x7x7 refrigerated cooler as an emergency light should there be a power failure or some clown turns off the power -- works fine.   The other two are outside but under an overhang.   They do not get direct hits from rain but they do get the "weather" -- works fine.   They seem well built enough to take direct hits from water, essentially they're a glorified flash light with very little that can go wrong.   Plus you don't need to take out a second mortgage to buy one.....   I's say, give it a try..........

summary: This tea kettle is 1000 watts, 120 volts and 60 Hertz. The bottom of the kettle is smooth stainless steel without exposed coils. The surface of the kettle will be hot to the touch during heating but the handle stays cool. The kettle is somewhat noisier than boiling water on the stovetop. The kettle has no battery. The base has an electric cord but the kettle can be removed from the base. The kettle is 8'' high and 6'' wide at the base, 8'' including the handle. The kettle holds 1.2 liters which is 6-1/2 cups. A full pot takes 7 minutes to boil and stays hot for at least 20 minutes. This kettle is made in China.

qa_pair.question: Is it really safe to submerge underwater for taking pics? Please any feedback would be very much appreciated.
qa_pair.answer: Absolutelly!  You can submerge it to 10m, enough for a pool or white sand beach.  You can open and close the lens lid without any problem, use flash underwater, etc.  Just two things, NEVER EVER open the door where the battery and microsd reside, because you will screw the camera.  And after use it underwater you have to clean the camera in the sink so you can clean it from chlorine from the pool or sand from the beach.  One last thing, be careful to use it on the beach so the sand won't scratch the lens area (the lid and underneath) and the screen.

rewrite.edit: you will screw the camera. And after use it underwater you have to clean the camera in the sink so you can clean it from chlorine from the pool or sand from the beach.

This product can be submerged up to 10 meters. You can open and close the lens without any issues and use flash underwater. Don't open the door where the battery is and clean it after underwater use.

qa_pair.question: Is it really safe to submerge underwater for taking pics? Please any feedback would be very much appreciated.
qa_pair.answer: I purchased to use while snorkeling. I even bought the insurance.Used 8 times - just at surface and water leaked in and camera wouldn't work.  When I sent it back to Sony, they said that the insurance did not cover water damage.  They offered me a new camera at the going rate.  No, it is not waterproof. Insurance is a joke.

summary: This product is a great camera that has a built in flash. This comes with a battery and charger but no data chip. You can choose AVCHD or MP4 format for filming movies but there is no memory card included. You can open and close the lens lid without any problems and be able to use the flash underwater. Once you use it underwater you will have to clean the camera in the sink so you can clean it from chlorine from the pool or sand from the beach.

qa_pair.question: Can these bits be used in a standard keyless chuck?
qa_pair.answer: No, They are designed specifically for SDS Plus type rotary hammer drills, not standard drills/hammer drills. They're built to slide up and down, and are not round where the a regular chuck would clamp them. If you need to drill into concrete, though, an SDS type drill and bits is the best way to go. It's night and day in the difference between using a regular drill with a hammer function and a rotary hammer drill and bit. Rotary hammer drills and bits cut like butter...at least my Bosch does. The bits last far longer and it cuts my labor time tremendously.

qa_pair.question: how do you get the ice cubes out?
qa_pair.answer: Push up from the bottom with moderate pressure. The silicone is very tough, don't have to be too gentle with it. Helps if all of the cavities are filled to the same level at the brim.

rewrite.edit: Product is meant to be pushed on from the bottom in order to release the ice cubes.

qa_pair.question: how do you get the ice cubes out?
qa_pair.answer: let the tray sit out on the counter for a few minutes, then gently push from the bottom of each square

qa_pair.question: how do you get the ice cubes out?
qa_pair.answer: The silicone sleeve is very flexible. You just bend it till they pop out, or you could run it upside down under hot running water for a minute. It is the rage with mixologists because the cubes take so long to melt in drinks! We have several.

qa_pair.question: how do you get the ice cubes out?
qa_pair.answer: They just pop out. It's a silicone mold, very flexible

qa_pair.question: how do you get the ice cubes out?
qa_pair.answer: It can be tricky until you get the hang of it. For me, the easiest way is to hold the tray upside down and push with my thumbs on the center of the cube well. Usually, the cube comes right out.

qa_pair.question: how do you get the ice cubes out?
qa_pair.answer: It's actually pretty hard to simply pop out because the ice cubes are so thick. I had to flip it upside down and melt it a little with water first and then push the ice cubes out individually.

qa_pair.question: how do you get the ice cubes out?
qa_pair.answer: The tray is flexible silicone so you can push them out individually, one by one.

summary: The stem of this umbrella is not made for placing in surfaces such as beach sand but it works well for level ground. The pole and ribs of the umbrella are made from metal and are painted white. The screws are plastic. As a rain umbrella it will only work for a light rain. It is less effective in a heavy rain. The umbrella does not include a clamp for attaching to a bleacher. The height of the umbrella can be adjusted from 3' to 8'. It opens to 60'' wide and has room for 2 adults. The umbrella is 8 pounds. The umbrella is easily collapsible with a push of a button. Despite its compactness and easy storage, it provides ample shade for 1-2 people. The umbrella is not tall enough to be used with a patio table and chairs. To secure the umbrella in windy conditions, metal rods are provided to pin it to the ground. A cooler or bags can be placed near the base but wind over 15mph may pose problems.
